title: Question 69

children: A 54-year-old woman is evaluated during a routine wellness examination. She is asymptomatic. An incidentally discovered oral finding is
Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

This patient has black hairy tongue. This benign condition is characterized by elongation and defective desquamation of filiform papillae and is more common in older men. It is sometimes associated with candidal infection, antibiotic use, Addison disease, niacin deficiency, or poor oral hygiene.
Acute development of a black hairy tongue secondary to penicillin use is
in a different patient. Penicillin may have inhibited the growth of normal oral bacteria and permitted the overgrowth of fungi, resulting in the elongated, dark filiform papillae.
